FOUND IN: Enniskillen - The largest town and administrative center in County Fermanagh, Northern Ireland.
Ingrain - to implant something in the mind by repeated instruction.

Suture - A stitch used in surgery or medical procedures to join two pieces of tissue, usually skin, but can also include tendons and other soft tissues attached to underlying structures such as bones.
Turning Point (narrative) - A pivotal moment within a story that dramatically alters the plot's direction or outcome.
Sark - An island with a parliamentary system that reports to the Lieutenant Governor; it's one of the bailiwicks in the Channel Islands.
Hearing - formal session where evidence and arguments are presented before a judge or jury during legal proceedings.
Beach Buggy - A motorized caster or trailer designed to carry passengers along sandy beaches.
Sovereign (referring to a monarch in retirement, such as King Emeritus)
Fret - Worry or trouble about (something) to the point of agitation.
